intro: Acinodendron goniocladum, commonly known as the African starwood, is a small evergreen tree native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, aromatic wood and distinctive star-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats and can reach heights of up to 10 meters. Its flowers are small and white, arranged in clusters, and it produces small, dark blue fruits. Due to its unique appearance and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
